EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron plate production setup at position around (16.0, 71.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner mining drill at position (16.0, 71.0) facing down, extracting iron ore.
- Stone furnace at position (16.0, 73.0) smelting iron ore into iron plates.
- Wooden chest at position (17.5, 73.5) collecting iron plates from the furnace.
- Burner inserter at position (16.5, 74.5) transferring iron ore from the mining drill to the furnace.
- Burner inserter at position (18.5, 73.5) moving iron plates from the furnace to the wooden chest.
- Burner inserter at position (19.5, 73.5) moving iron plates from the wooden chest to a transport belt.
- Transport belt at position (21.5, 73.5) moving iron plates away from the chest.
- Wooden chest at position (22.5, 73.5) placed to receive iron plates from the transport belt.

This structure forms a connected iron plate production line from ore extraction to plate output onto a belt and then into a secondary chest.

ERROR TIPS

### Errors placing entities due to occupied tiles and spacing issues
- Transport belt placement repeatedly failed near (19.5, 73.5) and (21.5, 73.5) due to existing entities occupying tiles. Increasing spacing or changing placement direction is necessary to avoid overlap.
- Attempting to place burner inserters between belt and chest at (22.5, 73.5) failed because the belt occupied the tile. Plan entity placement order and increase spacing to ensure free tiles.
- Removing entities (e.g., picking up transport belt at 21.5, 73.5) to free space for inserters is a workaround but requires having the entity in inventory for replacement.

### Inserter fuel and operation issues
- Burner inserters and furnace repeatedly ran out of fuel causing stoppages. Ensure sufficient coal is inserted regularly to keep all burner entities operational.
- Inserters showed statuses waiting for source items or waiting for space in destination, indicating bottlenecks in item flow. Monitor inventories and belt/chest capacities to maintain smooth throughput.

### Item insertion errors due to empty inventory or undefined variables
- Multiple exceptions occurred when trying to insert coal due to empty inventory despite prior harvesting. Verify inventory updates correctly after harvesting before attempting insertion.
- NameError occurred due to referencing undefined variable `belt_to_chest_inserter`. Maintain consistent naming and initialization of inserter entities before use.

### Inventory inspection errors on transport belts
- Attempts to inspect inventory of transport belts failed with "attempt to index a nil value" error because transport belts do not have inventories. Avoid inspecting inventories on belts; inspect chests or inserters instead.

### Entity placement failures due to missing items in inventory
- Failure to place burner inserter at (21.5, 73.5) due to no burner inserter item in inventory. Keep track of inventory items required for placement to avoid such exceptions.

NAMESPACE
No user-defined functions have been declared yet.
